definition: abbr. for 梵教[Fan4 jiao4] Brahmanism/abbr. for Sanskrit 梵語|梵语[Fan4 yu3] or 梵文[Fan4 wen2]/abbr. for 梵蒂岡|梵蒂冈[Fan4 di4 gang1], the Vatican
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]

sentences.english: He restored the traditional chanting and created more opportunities for monastics to propagate the Dharma by means of chanting.
sentences.chinese: 不但恢復傳統梵唄也同時培養了更多梵唄高僧來傳播。

sentences.english: He restored the traditional chanting and created more opportunities for monastics to propagate the Dharma by means of chanting.
sentences.chinese: 不但恢復傳統梵唄也同時培養了更多梵唄高僧來傳播。

sentences.english: Buddhism music originated form India, at first, it was chanted with Sanskrit, so called Fanbai.
sentences.chinese: 佛教音樂始於印度，初以梵文念唱又稱梵唄。

definition: to pass on the light of Buddha
Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang dynastic Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls
boundless life (expression of good wishes)/Amitayus, the Buddha of measureless life, good fortune and wisdom
formal ceremonial music of each succeeding Chinese dynasty starting with the Zhou/Korean a'ak/Japanese gagaku
